required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Strategy to Avoid Excessive Oxygen in Major Burn Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Strategy to Avoid Excessive Oxygen in Major Burn Patients (SAVE-O2)

brief_summary.textblock: The objective is to determine the effectiveness of a multimodal educational intervention to reduce supplemental oxygen use in major burn patients. Investigators will also evaluate the safety and clinical effectiveness of the more targeted use of oxygen therapy.

detailed_description.textblock:
Oxygen therapy has undisputed importance in the care of critically ill patients to prevent secondary complications related to hypoxia. Although routine, the practice of excessive over-oxygenation may be harmful. An expert panel was convened and developed the strong consensus to target normoxia at an oxygen saturation (SpO2) range of 90-96%, an arterial oxygen (PaO2) range of 60-100 mmHg (when applicable), and a fraction of inspired oxygen (FiO2) of 21% for mechanically ventilated patients or room air for nonmechanically ventilated patients.
Specific Aim: The purpose of this study is to determine the effectiveness of a multimodal educational intervention to reduce supplemental oxygen use in major burn patients. Investigators will also evaluate the safety and clinical effectiveness of the more targeted use of oxygen therapy.
Hypotheses: Clinical efforts to through a multimodal educational intervention will:
1. Improve the proportion of time spent within target normoxia thresholds (oxygen saturation [SpO2] 90-96% and/or arterial oxygen [PaO2] 60-100 mmHg [when applicable])
2. Limiting use of excessive supplemental oxygen
3. Reduce exposure to hyperoxia without a substantive increase in hypoxic episodes or adverse effects

primary_outcome.description: Number of days alive and not on supplemental oxygen during the index hospitalization (0 days [worst outcome] to 28 days [best outcome])

secondary_outcome.description: Number of days alive and outside the hospital (0 days [worst outcome] to 90 days [best outcome])
Dichotomous vital status (survived or died) at hospital discharge or day 90, whichever is first
Vital status and date of death censored at hospital discharge or day 90, whichever is first
Ventilator Free days = Days off ventilator (0 VFD [worst outcome] to 28 VFD [best outcome])
Duration of supplemental oxygen (FiO2 = 0.21 or room air)
Wound closure of >90% of the original burn or time to grafting (for non-full thickness wounds)
Defined as home (return to prior level of care) or facility (e.g., acute rehab, skilled nursing facility)
Total estimated oxygen volume while in the burn until after hospital arrival

secondary_outcome.measure: Duration of Time on Normoxia Protocol Target
secondary_outcome.description: Defined as SpO2 90-96% or receiving no supplemental oxygen (FiO2 0.21 or room air) while in the burn unit

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of Participants Receiving High Levels of Supplemental Oxygen
secondary_outcome.description: FiO2>0.40 or >4 liters per minute for >2 hours while in the burn unit [excludes time in the operating room]

secondary_outcome.measure: Duration of Time Receiving High Levels of Supplemental Oxygen
secondary_outcome.description: FiO2>0.40 or >4 liters per minute while in the burn unit

secondary_outcome.measure: Duration of Time Receiving No Supplemental Oxygen
secondary_outcome.description: FiO2 0.21 or room air while in the burn unit
SpO2 saturation below 88% while in the burn unit
SpO2 saturation below 88% while in the burn unit
SpO2 saturation above 96% while in the burn unit
SpO2 saturation above 96% while in the burn unit

arm_group.description: The control (pre-implementation) group will be burn patients admitted to the burn unit in ICU during the site's control period of the stepped-wedge implementation process (up to 22 months).

arm_group.arm_group_label: Post-Implementation Targeting Normoxia in Burn ICU
arm_group.description: The intervention (post-implementation) group will be patients admitted to the burn unit in ICU during the targeting normoxia intervention period of the stepped-wedge design implementation process (up to 19 months).

intervention.description: Post-implementation of targeted normoxia through oxygen titration for individual patients. Intervention for treatment of hypoxia will follow usual local practice. Interventions for treatment of hyperoxia (SpO2 >96% or PaO2 > 100 mmHg) will involve down titration of FiO2 (or supplemental oxygen for non-mechanically ventilated patients) within a time frame based on local site preferences-typically in increments of no greater than 0.10 until goal oxygenation in the normoxia range is achieved (including room air [no supplemental oxygen] for non-mechanically ventilated patients).
intervention.arm_group_label: Post-Implementation Targeting Normoxia in Burn ICU

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with acute thermal burn injury who meet the criteria for entry into the state or national burn data repository
- Admission to burn unit within 24 hours of burn injury
Exclusion Criteria:
- Age <18 years
- Prisoners
- Known pregnancy
